User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

On startup, FF should check whether the profile it is trying to open was last used with a newer version of FF. For instance, on opening a profile from FF4 with FF3.6, currently all the newer addons are deleted from the profile, followed by a dialog box which (thankfully) allows one to cancel the further startup procedure. (Whether other damaging changes are made to the profile before this dialog appears I do not know.)

A more graceful failure mode would at least flash up a warning before allowing the user to decide to continue at her own risk.

Obviously it is too late to add this to previous versions, but it would be nice to include it for the future, especially if version numbers are set to change more rapidly. While syncing may alleviate some of these issues, I am sure I am not the only user who sometimes restores .mozilla from a backup onto a different system from where it was last used.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Use FF4, add some addons
2.Open same profile with FF3.6
3.Trouble
